<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/26/congress-faces-three-big-deadlines-this-week-as-biden-agenda-hangs-in-balance?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Crunch Time for Congress
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/26/congress-faces-three-big-deadlines-this-week-as-biden-agenda-hangs-in-balance?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Nancy Pelosi " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/6d883b443ee46db2c09602d48497ee89170ab434-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong/Getty Images </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remember in college when you had three huge projects due on the same day? Democrats are feeling that same stress this week as they try to turn President Biden’s signature economic proposals into law.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">House Speaker Nancy Pelosi wants Democrats to <a href="https://apnews.com/article/politics-congress-budget-c6b234ff39f9a68afdd61fb3b402d848?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pass two huge packages</a>: 1) the roughly $1 trillion bipartisan infrastructure bill and 2) the $3.5 trillion spending bill that would inject an unprecedented amount of federal dollars into the social safety net, climate change mitigation, and education.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On top of all that, Congress will need to fund the federal government past Thursday at midnight in order to avoid a partial government shutdown.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The stakes are high. </strong>As they eye the midterm elections coming up next year, Democrats want to be able to show voters they can get things done and make a positive difference in Americans’ lives.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Breaking it down</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s where the three projects <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/congress-heads-into-tumultuous-week-pressured-by-converging-deadlines-11632657601?mod=hp_lead_pos2" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stand right now</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The infrastructure bill: </strong>This package would provide $600 billion in fresh funding to upgrade the country’s aging roads, bridges, transit, electric grid, and broadband networks. It’s already passed the Senate with support from Republicans, but more progressive Democrats want to prioritize the social spending bill. Still, Pelosi is <a href="https://www.axios.com/pelosi-booker-infrastructure-bill-8a798964-4623-4e7e-a38d-e8527b745c93.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bullish</a>: “Let me just say that we're going to pass the bill this week,” she said yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The social and environment spending bill: </strong>This one’s the biggest lightning rod. Many Democrats think this package will be transformative in cutting both poverty and carbon emissions, but Republicans (and some centrist Dems) are balking at the $3.5 trillion price tag. Expect the total cost to come down as Democrats seek a compromise.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The government shutdown: </strong>Because we can all agree it would be silly to shut down government operations during a pandemic, lawmakers say they could pass a short-term spending patch with bipartisan support to keep the lights on.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>These wild next few days in DC could make or break Biden’s domestic agenda.</p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH CARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/26/ny-health-care-leaders-warn-of-staffing-shortages-as-vaccine-mandate-kicks-in?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NY Health Officials Today
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/26/ny-health-care-leaders-warn-of-staffing-shortages-as-vaccine-mandate-kicks-in?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='A scene from Scrubs of JD saying "screams internally" ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0669c80f77bb75d440b25ff5b0f8b74945ecb47f-384x288.gif?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Speaking of deadlines, another big one looms: New York is <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/09/24/1040345626/ny-hospitals-worry-about-staff-shortages-as-monday-vaccine-deadline-approaches?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">requiring</a> employees in all hospitals and nursing homes to have received at least one shot of a Covid-19 vaccine as of today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While they're supportive of the requirement, officials are warning that the mandate could lead to staff shortages at hospitals and other health care facilities.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The largest health care provider in the state, Northwell Health, predicts it’ll have to </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/24/nyregion/coronavirus-hospitals-vaccines.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fire thousands of employees</a></span><span> who refuse to get vaccinated, per the NYT.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Buffalo’s Erie County Medical Center will suspend elective in-patient surgeries if it needs to fire hundreds of workers.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To help alleviate potential shortages, New York Gov. Kathy Hochul announced a <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/new-york-prepares-for-possible-staff-shortages-as-health-care-covid-vaccine-mandate-nears/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plan</a> on Saturday that includes calling in medically trained National Guard personnel.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This is not just a New York issue: </strong>The Biden administration wants to make sure every person working in health care is vaccinated, and a federal vax mandate for health care employees could begin as soon as next month. Officials across the US, particularly in rural areas, are <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/09/25/1040233493/rural-hospitals-worry-they-will-lose-staff-because-of-bidens-new-vaccine-mandate?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">concerned</a> they’ll lose staff.</p>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/26/germany-votes-in-federal-elections-that-will-determine-merkel-successor?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Life After Merkel
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="Angela Merkel " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/80b0489aeed3ee89f7913a4ab92a2bd5bf5f5235-5584x3723.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Angela Merkel not leading Germany is like someone other than Mike Krzyzewski coaching Duke basketball, but that’s what’s going to happen after Germans voted in federal elections yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Merkel, currently the longest-serving head of state in Europe, didn’t seek reelection after 16 years as chancellor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Her legacy: </strong>Merkel is credited with steering Europe’s largest economy—and really the entire continent—through a number of emergencies, including the 2008 financial meltdown, the 2015 migrant crisis, and the coronavirus pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whoever ends up succeeding Merkel, and it’s <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-europe-58644812?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not clear yet</a> who that is, will face increased pressure to confront climate change, a central issue in yesterday’s elections. Protestors <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-58681515?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rallied</a> in Germany ahead of the vote to pressure the government to do more to limit emissions. Merkel’s Germany has fallen short of its goals to reduce its carbon footprint, and remains a top-10 polluting country in the world.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Merkel will remain in charge as German lawmakers tussle to form a new government, which could take months.</p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Marvel’s <em>Shang-Chi </em>has become the <a href="https://www.axios.com/shang-chi-black-widow-biggest-film-north-america-2021-bccd5377-ea1f-4856-ab08-35bd82020553.html?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=editorial&utm_content=economy-business-shangchi" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top-grossing movie</a> at the North American box office this year, bringing in nearly $187 million, according to Comscore. In second place is another Marvel blockbuster—<em>Black Widow</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Within a year I think we will be able to come back to normal life.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/26/pfizer-ceo-albert-bourla-said-we-may-need-annual-covid-shots.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said on ABC</a> yesterday that we’ll get back to leading our normal lives (whatever that means anymore) in the not-too-distant future, but added that we’ll likely need yearly Covid shots.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Lab-grown meat is supposed to be inevitable. The science tells a different story. (<a href="https://thecounter.org/lab-grown-cultivated-meat-cost-at-scale/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Counter</a>)</p>
</div>

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We kind of cannibalized this section with the top story, but here’s what else you should look out for.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economic officials speak: </strong>Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and Fed Chair Jerome Powell will testify before Congress on Tuesday and Thursday about the country’s policy response to the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Q4 begins: </strong>The final quarter of the year will start on Friday, Oct. 1.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A holiday near and dear to our hearts, National Coffee Day, is on Wednesday.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Jon Stewart makes his return to television with a show on Apple TV+ on Thursday.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rAFfeGRbWLQ" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Many Saints of Newark</em></a></span><span>, which chronicles the early life of Tony Soprano, debuts Friday.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Walt Disney World turns 50 on Friday.</span></li>
</ul>
</div>

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s time to show the world just how much you love Morning Brew. And there’s no better way to do that than by rocking the coziest Brew joggers all winter long.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Getting your hands on these sweet sweats is easier than you’d think. All you need to do is refer <strong style="color:#000"><em>5 people</em> </strong>to the Brew this week using your unique link (see below).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The details:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Regardless of how many people you’ve already referred, you need to get at least 5 </span><span><em>new</em></span><span> confirmed referrals by October 3rd to win joggers.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Only the first 2,000 people to hit this threshold will get joggers, so lock them in now.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As always, only participants with a US address can win.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/refer-a-friend?access_token={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get your joggers now</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><br></p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCrunch Time for Congress\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Nancy Pelosi \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/6d883b443ee46db2c09602d48497ee89170ab434-1024x683.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlex Wong/Getty Images \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRemember in college when you had three huge projects due on the same day? Democrats are feeling that same stress this week as they try to turn President Biden’s signature economic proposals into law.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHouse Speaker Nancy Pelosi wants Democrats to \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/politics-congress-budget-c6b234ff39f9a68afdd61fb3b402d848?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epass two huge packages\u003c/a\u003e: 1) the roughly $1 trillion bipartisan infrastructure bill and 2) the $3.5 trillion spending bill that would inject an unprecedented amount of federal dollars into the social safety net, climate change mitigation, and education.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn top of all that, Congress will need to fund the federal government past Thursday at midnight in order to avoid a partial government shutdown.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe stakes are high. \u003c/strong\u003eAs they eye the midterm elections coming up next year, Democrats want to be able to show voters they can get things done and make a positive difference in Americans’ lives.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBreaking it down\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere’s where the three projects \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/congress-heads-into-tumultuous-week-pressured-by-converging-deadlines-11632657601?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estand right now\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe infrastructure bill: \u003c/strong\u003eThis package would provide $600 billion in fresh funding to upgrade the country’s aging roads, bridges, transit, electric grid, and broadband networks. It’s already passed the Senate with support from Republicans, but more progressive Democrats want to prioritize the social spending bill. Still, Pelosi is \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/pelosi-booker-infrastructure-bill-8a798964-4623-4e7e-a38d-e8527b745c93.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebullish\u003c/a\u003e: “Let me just say that we're going to pass the bill this week,” she said yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe social and environment spending bill: \u003c/strong\u003eThis one’s the biggest lightning rod. Many Democrats think this package will be transformative in cutting both poverty and carbon emissions, but Republicans (and some centrist Dems) are balking at the $3.5 trillion price tag. Expect the total cost to come down as Democrats seek a compromise.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe government shutdown: \u003c/strong\u003eBecause we can all agree it would be silly to shut down government operations during a pandemic, lawmakers say they could pass a short-term spending patch with bipartisan support to keep the lights on.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThese wild next few days in DC could make or break Biden’s domestic agenda.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAngela Merkel not leading Germany is like someone other than Mike Krzyzewski coaching Duke basketball, but that’s what’s going to happen after Germans voted in federal elections yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMerkel, currently the longest-serving head of state in Europe, didn’t seek reelection after 16 years as chancellor.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHer legacy: \u003c/strong\u003eMerkel is credited with steering Europe’s largest economy—and really the entire continent—through a number of emergencies, including the 2008 financial meltdown, the 2015 migrant crisis, and the coronavirus pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhoever ends up succeeding Merkel, and it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-europe-58644812?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot clear yet\u003c/a\u003e who that is, will face increased pressure to confront climate change, a central issue in yesterday’s elections. Protestors \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-58681515?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erallied\u003c/a\u003e in Germany ahead of the vote to pressure the government to do more to limit emissions. Merkel’s Germany has fallen short of its goals to reduce its carbon footprint, and remains a top-10 polluting country in the world.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eMerkel will remain in charge as German lawmakers tussle to form a new government, which could take months.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
